016
017package org.parboiled;
018
019import org.parboiled.parse.Context;
020import org.parboiled.parse.ContextAware;
021import org.parboiled.support.Checks;
022import org.parboiled.support.IndexRange;
023import org.parboiled.support.Position;
024
025import static org.parboiled.common.Preconditions.checkArgNotNull;
026
027/**
028 * Convenience context aware base class defining a number of useful helper methods.
029 *
030 * @param <V> the type of the parser values
031 */
032@SuppressWarnings( {"UnusedDeclaration"})
033public abstract class BaseActions<V> implements ContextAware<V> {
034
035    private Context<V> context;
036
037    /**
038     * The current context for use with action methods. Updated immediately before action calls.
039     *
040     * @return the current context
041     */
042    public Context<V> getContext() {
043        return context;
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * ContextAware interface implementation.
048     *
049     * @param context the context
050     */
051    public void setContext(Context<V> context) {
052        this.context = checkArgNotNull(context, "context");
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Returns the current index in the input buffer.
057     *
058     * @return the current index
059     */
060    public int currentIndex() {
061        check();
062        return context.getCurrentIndex();
063    }
064
065    /**
066     * <p>Returns the input text matched by the rule immediately preceding the action expression that is currently
067     * being evaluated. This call can only be used in actions that are part of a Sequence rule and are not at first
068     * position in this Sequence.</p>
069     *
070     * @return the input text matched by the immediately preceding subrule
071     */
072    public String match() {
073        check();
074        return context.getMatch();
075    }
076    
077    /**
078     * Creates a new {@link IndexRange} instance covering the input text matched by the rule immediately preceding the
079     * action expression that is currently being evaluated. This call can only be used in actions that are part of a
080     * Sequence rule and are not at first position in this Sequence.
081     *  
082     * @return a new IndexRange instance
083     */
084    public IndexRange matchRange() {
085        check();
086        return context.getMatchRange();
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * <p>Returns the input text matched by the rule immediately preceding the action expression that is currently
091     * being evaluated. If the matched input text is empty the given default string is returned.
092     * This call can only be used in actions that are part of a Sequence rule and are not at first
093     * position in this Sequence.</p>
094     *
095     * @param defaultString the default string to return if the matched input text is empty
096     * @return the input text matched by the immediately preceding subrule or the default string
097     */
098    public String matchOrDefault(String defaultString) {
099        check();
100        String match = context.getMatch();
101        return match.length() == 0 ? defaultString : match;
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * <p>Returns the first character of the input text matched by the rule immediately preceding the action
106     * expression that is currently being evaluated. This call can only be used in actions that are part of a Sequence
107     * rule and are not at first position in this Sequence.</p>
108     * <p>If the immediately preceding rule did not match anything this method throws a GrammarException. If you need
109     * to able to handle that case use the getMatch() method.</p>
110     *
111     * @return the first input char of the input text matched by the immediately preceding subrule or null,
112     *         if the previous rule matched nothing
113     */
114    public char matchedChar() {
115        check();
116        return context.getFirstMatchChar();
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * <p>Returns the start index of the rule immediately preceding the action expression that is currently
121     * being evaluated. This call can only be used in actions that are part of a Sequence rule and are not at first
122     * position in this Sequence.</p>
123     *
124     * @return the start index of the context immediately preceding current action
125     */
126    public int matchStart() {
127        check();
128        return context.getMatchStartIndex();
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * <p>Returns the end location of the rule immediately preceding the action expression that is currently
133     * being evaluated. This call can only be used in actions that are part of a Sequence rule and are not at first
134     * position in this Sequence.</p>
135     *
136     * @return the end index of the context immediately preceding current action, i.e. the index of the character
137     *         immediately following the last matched character
138     */
139    public int matchEnd() {
140        check();
141        return context.getMatchEndIndex();
142    }
143    
144    /**
145     * <p>Returns the number of characters matched by the rule immediately preceding the action expression that is
146     * currently being evaluated. This call can only be used in actions that are part of a Sequence rule and are not
147     * at first position in this Sequence.</p>
148     * 
149     * @return the number of characters matched
150     */
151    public int matchLength() {
152        check();
153        return context.getMatchLength();
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * <p>Returns the current position in the underlying {@link org.parboiled.buffers.InputBuffer} as a
158     * {@link Position} instance.</p>
159     * 
160     * @return the current position in the underlying inputbuffer
161     */
162    public Position position() {
163        check();
164        return context.getPosition();
165    }
166
167    /**
168     * Pushes the given value onto the value stack. Equivalent to push(0, value).
169     *
170     * @param value the value to push
171     * @return true
172     */
173    public boolean push(V value) {
174        check();
175        context.getValueStack().push(value);
176        return true;
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Inserts the given value a given number of elements below the current top of the value stack.
181     *
182     * @param down  the number of elements to skip before inserting the value (0 being equivalent to push(value))
183     * @param value the value
184     * @return true
185     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack does not contain enough elements to perform this operation
186     */
187    public boolean push(int down, V value) {
188        check();
189        context.getValueStack().push(down, value);
190        return true;
191    }
192
193    /**
194     * Pushes all given elements onto the value stack (in the order as given).
195     *
196     * @param firstValue the first value
197     * @param moreValues the other values
198     * @return true
199     */
200    public boolean pushAll(V firstValue, V... moreValues) {
201        check();
202        context.getValueStack().pushAll(firstValue, moreValues);
203        return true;
204    }
205
206    /**
207     * Removes the value at the top of the value stack and returns it.
208     *
209     * @return the current top value
210     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack is empty
211     */
212    public V pop() {
213        check();
214        return context.getValueStack().pop();
215    }
216
217    /**
218     * Removes the value the given number of elements below the top of the value stack.
219     *
220     * @param down the number of elements to skip before removing the value (0 being equivalent to pop())
221     * @return the value
222     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack does not contain enough elements to perform this operation
223     */
224    public V pop(int down) {
225        check();
226        return context.getValueStack().pop(down);
227    }
228
229    /**
230     * Removes the value at the top of the value stack.
231     *
232     * @return true
233     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack is empty
234     */
235    public boolean drop() {
236        check();
237        context.getValueStack().pop();
238        return true;
239    }
240
241    /**
242     * Removes the value the given number of elements below the top of the value stack.
243     *
244     * @param down the number of elements to skip before removing the value (0 being equivalent to drop())
245     * @return true
246     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack does not contain enough elements to perform this operation
247     */
248    public boolean drop(int down) {
249        check();
250        context.getValueStack().pop(down);
251        return true;
252    }
253
254    /**
255     * Returns the value at the top of the value stack without removing it.
256     *
257     * @return the current top value
258     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack is empty
259     */
260    public V peek() {
261        check();
262        return context.getValueStack().peek();
263    }
264
265    /**
266     * Returns the value the given number of elements below the top of the value stack without removing it.
267     *
268     * @param down the number of elements to skip (0 being equivalent to peek())
269     * @return the value
270     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack does not contain enough elements to perform this operation
271     */
272    public V peek(int down) {
273        check();
274        return context.getValueStack().peek(down);
275    }
276
277    /**
278     * Replaces the current top value of the value stack with the given value. Equivalent to poke(0, value).
279     *
280     * @param value the value
281     * @return true
282     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack is empty
283     */
284    public boolean poke(V value) {
285        check();
286        context.getValueStack().poke(value);
287        return true;
288    }
289
290    /**
291     * Replaces the element the given number of elements below the current top of the value stack.
292     *
293     * @param down  the number of elements to skip before replacing the value (0 being equivalent to poke(value))
294     * @param value the value to replace with
295     * @return true
296     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack does not contain enough elements to perform this operation
297     */
298    public boolean poke(int down, V value) {
299        check();
300        context.getValueStack().poke(down, value);
301        return true;
302    }
303
304    /**
305     * Duplicates the top value of the value stack. Equivalent to push(peek()).
306     *
307     * @return true
308     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the stack is empty
309     */
310    public boolean dup() {
311        check();
312        context.getValueStack().dup();
313        return true;
314    }
315
316    /**
317     * Swaps the top two elements of the value stack.
318     *
319     * @return true
320     * @throws org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException
321     *          if the stack does not contain at least two elements
322     */
323    public boolean swap() {
324        check();
325        context.getValueStack().swap();
326        return true;
327    }
328
329    /**
330     * Reverses the order of the top 3 value stack elements.
331     *
332     * @return true
333     * @throws org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException
334     *          if the stack does not contain at least 3 elements
335     */
336    public boolean swap3() {
337        check();
338        context.getValueStack().swap3();
339        return true;
340    }
341
342    /**
343     * Reverses the order of the top 4 value stack elements.
344     *
345     * @return true
346     * @throws org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException
347     *          if the stack does not contain at least 4 elements
348     */
349    public boolean swap4() {
350        check();
351        context.getValueStack().swap4();
352        return true;
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * Reverses the order of the top 5 value stack elements.
357     *
358     * @return true
359     * @throws org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException
360     *          if the stack does not contain at least 5 elements
361     */
362    public boolean swap5() {
363        check();
364        context.getValueStack().swap5();
365        return true;
366    }
367
368    /**
369     * Reverses the order of the top 6 value stack elements.
370     *
371     * @return true
372     * @throws org.parboiled.errors.GrammarException
373     *          if the stack does not contain at least 6 elements
374     */
375    public boolean swap6() {
376        check();
377        context.getValueStack().swap6();
378        return true;
379    }
380
381    /**
382     * Returns the next input character about to be matched.
383     *
384     * @return the next input character about to be matched
385     */
386    public Character currentChar() {
387        check();
388        return context.getCurrentChar();
389    }
390
391    /**
392     * Returns true if the current rule is running somewhere underneath a Test/TestNot rule.
393     * Useful for example for making sure actions are not run inside of a predicate evaluation:
394     * <pre>
395     * return Sequence(
396     * ...,
397     * inPredicate() || actions.doSomething()
398     * );
399     * </pre>
400     *
401     * @return true if in a predicate
402     */
403    public boolean inPredicate() {
404        check();
405        return context.inPredicate();
406    }
407
408    /**
409     * Returns true if the current context is for or below a rule marked {@literal @SuppressNode} or below one
410     * marked {@literal @SuppressSubnodes}.
411     *
412     * @return true or false
413     */
414    public boolean nodeSuppressed() {
415        check();
416        return context.isNodeSuppressed();
417    }
418
419    /**
420     * Determines whether the current rule or a sub rule has recorded a parse error.
421     * Useful for example for making sure actions are not run on erroneous input:
422     * <pre>
423     * return Sequence(
424     * ...,
425     * !hasError() &amp;&amp; actions.doSomething()
426     * );
427     * </pre>
428     *
429     * @return true if either the current rule or a sub rule has recorded a parse error
430     */
431    public boolean hasError() {
432        check();
433        return context.hasError();
434    }
435
436    private void check() {
437        Checks.ensure(context != null && context.getMatcher() != null,
438                "Illegal rule definition: Unwrapped action expression!");
439    }
440
441}
